example[0]: He has recently been promoted to Assistant Manager.
example[2]: Jerry lived in Cairo until quite recently.
example[3]: More recently, he’s appeared in a number of British films.
definition[1]: not long ago, especially a few days, weeks, or months ago
example[4]: The president has recently returned from a tour of South America.
example[5]: A new species of plant was recently discovered in Brazil.
definition[2]: during the recent past, especially during the weeks or days closest to now
example[6]: I’ve been really busy lately so I haven’t been out much.
example[7]: There hasn’t been much in the news lately.
definition[3]: a very short time ago, especially only a few minutes, hours, days, or weeks ago
example[9]: They’ve just had a new baby.
definition[4]: not long ago – often used when you are not sure exactly when
example[10]: That house was sold a short while ago.
example[11]: I looked in on her a little while ago and she was fast asleep.
definition[5]: recently, especially only a few days ago
example[12]: I met Lucy in town the other day.
example[13]: You’ll never guess what happened to me the other day.
definition[6]: made, prepared, done etc not long ago – used especially about food and drink. Also used about things that have just been painted, washed, or dug
example[16]: The boat had been freshly painted.
definition[7]: created, built, married etc not long ago
example[17]: the newly created position of Chief Designer
